text:
(1)
East River, skyline, north from Rivington Street, and showing piers 50, 51, 52, 55 and 56 off Tompkins Street.
October 19, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, at a later date.
September 18, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, at a later date, showing construction work in progress on the East River Driveway. In the background is visible the Queensborough Bridge, Welfare Island and the shore of Brooklyn. The vantage point for the three views is the Williamsburg Bridge.
September 1, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
title: East River - shore and skyline ; Queensborough bridge ; Williamsburg bridge.

text:
(1) Tompkins Street, east side, at Rivington Street. Also shown across clearance, is Rivington Street, south side, between East and Tompkins Streets. Note the Williamsburg Bridge in the background.

September 16, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) Showing the N.E. corner of Tompkins at Rivington Streets. On the right, is the north side of Rivington Street, east to East Street. The view in actuality, shows a portion of Brooklyn (across East River).

September 11, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) A view eastward of what was formerly Rivington Street. Note total demolition of everything east of Tompkins Street which has become a link in the new East River Drive.

December 12, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Tompkins Street, at and adjoining the S.W. corner of Rivington Street.

March 29, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, slightly more inclusive, as seen thru clearance at the S.E. corner of Rivington Street. Also shown is a view westward, of the south side of Rivington Street.

March 29, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
Similar to No. 1.

January 14, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

Tompkins Street, west side, south from, but not including Rivington to Broome Streets. Note demolition in the foreground of all buildings east of Tompkins to East Streets, for the new East River Drive. Projecting eastward, over the view is the East River (Williamsburg) Bridge.

March 29, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

An auto "graveyard" on the N.E. corner of Rivington and Tompkins Streets.
January 14, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

Ng # 3539
title: Automobiles - Junkyards.
